intro: Rhacodiscus acuminatissimus, commonly known as the spiky water fern, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are divided into four lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and lakes. Its reproductive structures include small, floating fruits that release spores into the water. Rhacodiscus acuminatissimus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life.
